dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper outlines the methodology of an evaluation of telemedicine in an Accident and Emergency AAndE setting Telemedicine technology consisting of ISDN 2 based videoconferencing and store And forward software has been installed and is currently being evaluated in two minor injury units MIUs and a District General Hospital DGH AAndE department in Lincolnshire A cost benefit analysis will be conducted using a pragmatic prospective case control study with both a concurrent and retrospective control group Any differences in resource use including direct and indirect costs between the intervention Telemedicine and the control No Telemedicine groups will be identified from both a patient and NHS perspective A variety of health and non health outcome measures will be recorded including staff and patient acceptability of the new technology
Computer methods and programs in biomedicine
Evaluating telemedicine in an accident and emergency setting.
